page.title: 01Cowlinge and Little Bradley
page.content: Close to the Essex and Cambridgeshire borders lies the Suffolk village of Cowlinge and the tiny hamlet of Little Bradley. The main street in Cowlinge is lined with a mixture of very old or very new houses and cottages, and the whole area has a scattering of both farm houses and cottages. It has one public house, one post office, one shop, a church and a telephone box. The whole of which is surrounded by arable farmland. Little Bradley lies approx. three kilometres to the south-east and now consists of one farm house and its attendant workers' cottages. There is a public telephone here. Nearest towns are Haverhill and Newmarket, each approx eight miles away and Bury St. Edmunds fifteen miles away.
